required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Adiponectin and TNFa on Uterine Contractility in GDM and Obese Pregnant Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate the effect of two adipokines which are adiponectin and TNFa on the force of myometrial contractility in diabetic, non-obese pregnant women and obese, non-diabetic term pregnant women at the time of scheduled cesarean delivery

primary_outcome.description: Determine the effect of adiponectin and TNFa on the force of myometrial contractility in diabetic, non-obese pregnant women and obese, non-diabetic term pregnant women at the time of scheduled cesarean delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Force of contractility between study groups
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the force of myometrial contractility in study groups compared to control group (non-DM, non-obese term pregnant patients)
Investigate the anti-inflammatory properties of Progesterone (P4) and 17a-Hydroxyprogesterone (HPC) on Adiponectin induced myometrial contractility in control group

arm_group.description: Healthy, term, non-obese (BMI < 30) pregnant women with a singleton gestation scheduled for CS delivery at 37-41 weeks of gestation.
Term pregnant, non-obese (BMI <30), diagnosed with gestational diabetes, scheduled for CS delivery between 37-41 weeks of gestation.
Term pregnant, obese (BMI >30), non-diabetic and scheduled for CS delivery between 37-41 weeks of gestation

intervention.description: Adiponectin and TNFa are adipokines. Will be added to the myometrial biopsies to investigate their effect on the force of contractility

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant subjects undergoing a scheduled C-section delivery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant patients scheduled for a CS at 37-41 weeks of gestation at M Health Birth Place
- Participants age â‰¥18.
- Full informed consent able to be provided by the participant.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing general anesthesia for their CS.
- Pre-gestational DM, and DM diagnosed <24 weeks gestation.
- Patients unable to consent for themselves
- Multiple gestation

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute
